link_metadata.description: The Secret Service has uncovered a vast network of over 100,000 SIM cards and 300 servers in the New York area, believed to be used by foreign "nation-state threat actors" and criminals for swatting calls targeting prominent conservatives and potentially disabling cell phone towers.
